Stem: Cylindrical, hairless, with streaks, reddish purple or green, with smooth nodes.
Leaves: Flat, up to 15 cm long, no ligule (joint structure), often reddish at base, hairless, sometimes with purplish stripes.
Flowers: Green to purplish with many spikelets in a neat row.
Habitat: Cropland, gardens, roadsides, neglected land, waterways.
DistinguishingFeatures: Spikelets in neater rows than Echinochloa crus-galli.

Photos.Caption: Grows flat when young, occasionally with stripes
